title: The title of this story is "60 Seconds."
body:
As the metal door clanged shut, the sound of the crowd outside echoed through the small room. Elon Musk stood in front of me, a satisfied smirk on his face. He had won, and I had lost.

I was strapped into a spacesuit, and my oxygen levels were quickly dwindling. In front of me was a large window, and beyond that, the infinite blackness of space. Musk was right, the crowd was cheering. I could see their tiny figures in the distance, a blur of movement against the background of the earth.

And then I was moving, the car slowly creeping forward until it reached the edge of the launchpad. I was weightless for a moment as the car left the ground, and then I was pressed back into my seat by the G-forces.

The earth was getting smaller and smaller, until it was nothing more than a blue dot in the distance. And then even that was gone, and I was alone in the vastness of space.

The radio crackled to life, Musk's voice cutting through the static. "Enjoy your eternity, Mr Bond."

title: The New world
body: You awake to a world of darkness. It has been two years since The Great Blinding occurred, and you have lost all hope of ever regaining your sight. Suddenly, without warning, your sight returns. You look around, trying to make sense of what has happened, and you realize that every available wall, floor and surface has been painted with the same message - "Don't Tell Them You Can See." At first, you are confused, but then you realize that the world has changed since The Great Blinding. The people who can see are now the outcasts, the ones who are not to be trusted. You must keep your ability to see a secret if you want to survive in this new world.

title: The Big Screen
body: When I died, I appeared in a cinema with a number of other people who looked like me. We found out that we were our previous reincarnations, and soon we all began watching our next life on the big screen. It was strange to see myself from a third-person perspective, but it was also interesting to see how my life could have been different. I could see all the mistakes I made and how they led me to my current situation. It was a lot to take in, but it was also strangely comforting to know that everything happens for a reason.

title: The title of this story is "3 AM".
body: I can't believe it's 3 AM already. I was just about to fall asleep when my phone went off. I thought it was just another notification, but then I saw the alert. It said "DO NOT LOOK AT THE MOON". I have no idea what that means, but I'm not about to look outside to find out. I have hundreds of notifications from random numbers that say "It's a beautiful night tonight. Look outside." I'm not sure what's going on, but I'm not going to take any chances. I'm going to stay inside where it's safe.

title: Sitting, Waiting, Hoping
body:
You're sitting at a table in a fancy restaurant, waiting for your date to arrive. You hired a female prostitute to pretend to be your colleague from the bank, and you're hoping to get some good dirt on your boss by eavesdropping on their conversation.

Suddenly, you see your date walking in with a handsome man. You realize with a start that you hired a male prostitute by mistake. Oh well, you think, this could be interesting too.

You sit at a table next to theirs and listen to their conversation. They're discussing their recent experiences with clients, and it's clear that they're both very good at their jobs. You can't help but feel a little turned on by the things they're saying.

After a while, you can't take it anymore. You get up, walk over to their table, and introduce yourself. You tell them that you're interested in hiring both of them for a private session. They agree, and you head back to your table to finish your drink.

You can't believe what a lucky mistake you made. You not only got some good dirt on your boss, but you also got to listen in on a hot conversation and ended up hiring two prostitutes for a private session. You can't wait to see what happens next.

title: The title of this story could be "Ninjas: Why Japan's Suck."
body: Every country has ninjas, but the world only knows about Japan's because theirs suck. The other ninjas are so much better at hiding that no one ever knows they're there. They're the ones who stop wars before they start and take out the world's most dangerous criminals. But because Japan's ninjas are so bad, no one takes them seriously. That's why the other ninjas have to do all the heavy lifting.

title: The Last Magic Users
body: Humans once wielded formidable magical power, but with over 7 billion of us on the planet, Mana has now spread too thinly to have any effect. However, when hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover that an old power has begun to reawaken once again. With this newfound power, they are able to repel the aliens and save humanity.

title: The Unexpected Love
body:
Ever since she was a little girl, she had always been told that her true love would find her when she least expected it. She had always envisioned her wedding day, and the handsome man who would sweep her off her feet. As she grew older, she began to date, but it never seemed to work out. The guys she dated were always either too clingy, too aloof, or just plain boring. She was beginning to lose hope that she would ever find her true love.

One day, she went on a blind date with a guy who was recommended to her by a friend. He was everything she had ever wanted in a man; he was handsome, charming, and funny. They hit it off immediately, and she was sure that she had finally found her true love.

However, after a few months of dating, she began to notice that he was acting strange. He would often disappear for hours at a time, and she was never quite sure where he was. She began to suspect that he was seeing other women, but she couldn't be sure.

One day, she confronted him about her suspicions, and he finally admitted that he was seeing other women. She was heartbroken, and she ended their relationship.

A few weeks later, she ran into him on the street. He told her that he had been trying to break up with her for months, but he just couldn't do it. He said that he loved her, but he wasn't ready for a serious relationship.

She was confused, and she asked him why he had been dating her if he didn't want a serious relationship. He told her that he had been trying to figure that out himself.

She realized then that she had been dating the same guy over and over; a shapeshifter who was unsure of his true form, but was certain that he loved her.

title: "Lillianna had always been a light sleeper"
body:
Lillianna had always been a light sleeper. She would often wake up in the middle of the night, thinking she heard a noise or feeling like she needed to use the restroom. But no matter how many times she checked, there was never anything there. As she got older, Lillianna began to realize that the noises and feelings were all just part of the human experience. We are constantly bombarded with stimuli, both internally and externally, that our minds can't always process. So, in order to protect us from overload, our mind sends us into a deep sleep each night. In this dream state, our mind sorts through all of the information we've taken in and prepares us for the next day.

However, there is one dream that is different from all the others. This dream is the moment of our death. As our life flashes before our eyes, we are really just waking up from all of the previous dreams. One by one, we relive each moment, good and bad, until we finally come to the end. And then, we wake up for the last time.

title: My Special Gift
body: I was born with a special gift. Whenever I speak, people hear me speaking in their native language. Most people are surprised and delighted. The cashier at McDonalds I've just talked to is horrified. "Nobody's spoken that language in thousands of years."

title: It's a Tuesday morning, and you're sitting in the Oval Office, looking out the window at the sunlit lawn. It's been a tough few weeks – first the Supreme Court ruling on your healthcare law, then the terrorist attack in Nice, and now you're dealing with the aftermath of the shootings in Dallas
body:
You're Barack Obama. 4 months into your retirement, you awake to find a letter with no return address on your bedside table. It reads "I hope you've had a chance to relax Barack...but pack your bags and call the number below. It's time to start the real job." Signed simply, "JFK."

The number is for a private jet, and before you know it, you're on your way to an undisclosed location. When you arrive, you're met by a man who looks eerily similar to JFK.

"Welcome, Mr. President," he says. "It's time to get to work."

He takes you to a secret underground facility where you're introduced to a team of scientists working on a top secret project. They need your help, and it's clear that this is going to be the biggest challenge of your life.

title: The Bouncer
body: You're the perfect bouncer because you can see people's age in years as an invisible number above their heads. One day you see a four digit number. The person is clearly too young to be in the club, so you turn them away.

title:
The show was a huge hit with the audience of restless ghosts, but Steve didn't know the half of it.

The creatures he was wrangling were actually the souls of sinners, and each time he managed to 'tame' one, their time in purgatory was reduced.

It was
body:
It was the hottest show in the afterlife for the past decade: Steve Irwin wrangling all sorts of supernatural creatures. He would never have guessed that his skills would come in handy after he died, but he was glad that he could still entertain people even in the afterlife. He had always been a bit of a daredevil, and now he was putting his life on the line for the amusement of others.

It was a dangerous job, but Steve loved it. He was always excited to see what new creature he would be wrangling each day. Some days it would be a group of mischievous ghosts, other days a pack of vampires. No matter what, Steve was always up for the challenge.

The show was a huge hit, and Steve was quickly becoming a celebrity in the afterlife. He was even starting to get fan mail from otherworldly creatures. It was all very surreal, but Steve was loving every minute of it.

One day, Steve was wrangling a group of demons when one of them got loose and came after him. Steve fought bravely, but the demon was too strong. It looked like he was about to meet his end when Suddenly, a group of ghosts came to his rescue and defeated the demon.

Steve was grateful to the ghosts for saving his life, and he invited them to be guests on his show. It was a ratings hit, and Steve was glad that he could continue entertaining people in the afterlife.

title: A group of scientists went into isolation to study a new virus. The virus was deadly and they were the only ones who knew how to stop it. They worked day and night to find a cure, but the virus was too powerful. They all died, one by one, until there was only one left. The
body: No one else went into isolation. The United States come out of exile, only to learn that following World War III, all the nations of the world had agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. The United States had been the only nation to adhere to the agreement. Now, 50 years later, they were the only nation left in the world.

title:
"Space is the final frontier," he would often say to anyone who would listen. "It's where we'll all end up one day."

As he grew older, John's obsession with space only intensified. He would spend hours watching documentaries about the cosmos and reading books about the stars.

body: Ever since he was a little boy, John had always loved space. He would gaze up at the stars for hours on end, dreaming of what might be out there. So when he saw an ad online for "buying a star", he just had to do it. It was a bit of a joke, really. He didn't actually think he would be buying a real star. But lo and behold, in 2017, his nerdy great great great great grandfather bought a star, and through some modern legal shenanigans, John is now the proud owner of a small intergalactic empire. He's not quite sure what to do with it, but he's going to have a lot of fun finding out.

title: A life without bees.
body: Your entire life you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say, "Your Majesty, what are your orders?"

title: The Great Fatherhood Shake-Up
body: All of the "#1 Dad" mugs in the world change to show the actual ranking of Dads suddenly. This causes a lot of dads to feel insecure, especially those who were previously ranked highly. To make matters worse, the rankings are constantly changing, so no one can really be sure where they stand. This leads to a lot of Dad-related arguments and some dads even resort to cheating to try to ensure that they retain their top spot. In the end, it's just a mug, but it's a symbol of something that is very important to dads: their relationship with their children.

title: "I've been waiting years for this day!" the alien exclaimed. "Now I can finally study humans up close!"
body:
The alien was so excited to have finally captured a human. Matt Damon was the most sought after human on their planet and the alien was sure to be rewarded handsomely for his capture.

The alien had no idea what lengths humanity would go through to retrieve him. They sent in their best military forces and even resorted to using weapons of mass destruction. In the end, they were successful in rescuing Matt Damon and the alien was never heard from again.

title: The world's most powerful supervillain is now a has-been.
body: You were once the world's most powerful supervillain. You caused mass destruction and chaos wherever you went. But then, one day, you were defeated by a super hero. This hero had the power to wipe memories of both the villain and everyone who knew of them so that they could be reintroduced into society safely. You were one of the lucky ones. Your memory was completely wiped. You had no idea who you were or what you had done. But, deep down, you knew that you were different. You had a darkness inside of you that you couldn't explain. And, eventually, that darkness would take over and you would become the villain once again.

title: The Great Kiddie Pool Ball Escape
body: I was at the park with my friends and we were trying to figure out how to get the ball out of the kiddie pool. We tried using a stick, but it didn't work. We tried using our hands, but that didn't work either. We tried using a rope, but that didn't work either. We were about to give up when we saw a little girl walking by with her mom. She walked up to the kiddie pool and dipped her hand in. She then walked away and we were able to get the ball out. We were so happy and we thanked the little girl.

title: The First Few Years
body:
The first few years were great. Everyone was young and beautiful and the world felt like it was at our fingertips. But then, as more and more people took the drug, things started to change. The world became a place for the young. The old were ignored, pushed to the wayside. We became the lost generation.

Now, 85 years later, the side effects of the drug are finally being discovered. The young are becoming immortal, but they are also losing their human emotions. They are becoming cold, heartless creatures. The world is now a place of eternal youth, but it is also a place of eternal darkness.

title: The Time When Earth Was Doomed
body: There was a time when Earth was doomed. The signs were all there; the dystopian societies, the wars, the pollution. It was only a matter of time before the world ended. But then, in the nick of time, a mystical dagger appeared. This dagger had the power to resurrect anyone who was killed by it on an alternate Earth. In one world, the person who wielded the dagger was a hero, revered by all. In the other world, that same person was the most notorious serial killer of all time.

title: I loved that dog.
body:
My German Shepard had to be put down today. We never knew where he came from. Please write about his adventures.

My German Shepard, Max, was always an adventurous dog. He loved to explore the woods behind our house and chase rabbits. He was always so happy and playful.

We got Max as a puppy and he quickly became a part of our family. We loved him so much.

But today, Max had to be put down. He was old and sick and it was time for him to go.

As we said our final goodbyes, I couldn't help but think about all of the wonderful adventures Max had been on. I knew he had a good life, filled with love and happiness.

And even though we never knew where he came from, Max will always be a part of our family. We will never forget him and the joy he brought into our lives.

title:
The darkness had come early. Thick clouds had rolled in, blotting out the last vestiges of daylight. A strong wind had picked up, sending leaves and branches flying. And now, as night fell, the rain had started. It pounded against the windows, creating a constant din.

Inside,
body:
It was a dark and stormy night. Phillip had been driving home from work, and was now about an hour away from his house. He had made it the last few miles, but was now in the throes of a full-blown panic attack. His breaths came in short gasps and his heart was pounding so hard, it felt like it was trying to escape his chest. He pulled to the side of the road, scattering gravel, and tried to calm himself. He closed his eyes and took several deep breaths before starting the car. He crept along the road, his car the only light in a wide and dark world. The rain continued to beat against the windshield like the footsteps of some unseen thing.

Phillip pulled into his driveway and quickly got out of the car, running to the front door. He fumbled with his keys, finally getting the door open and slamming it shut behind him. He leaned against it, panting, and tried to calm his racing heart. He turned on the lights and looked around. The house was empty and quiet. He went to the living room and sat on the couch, trying to convince himself that he was safe.

Suddenly, he heard a noise at the door. He froze, his heart starting to race again. There was a knock, and then the door opened. A figure stood in the doorway, silhouetted by the moonlight and the rain. Phillip's heart stopped. He knew what this was. He had heard the stories his whole life. He tried to run, but it was too late. The vampire had him in its grasp.

title:
"We've been waiting for an hour," said Gluttony. "Where's Lust?"

"I don't know," said Envy. "She's probably off screwing some guy."

"That's not like her," said Pride. "She's usually very punctual."
body: The other six members of the Seven Deadly Sins were getting impatient. It was already the end of Pride Month, and they hadn't gotten a single day dedicated to them. Meanwhile, Pride was getting frustrated with them. He tried to explain that he wasn't the focus of Pride Month, but they just didn't seem to understand.

title: The Gates of Hell
body:
You stand at the entrance to hell, looking upon the chaos that has ensued. The ground is scorched and the air is thick with the stench of sulfur. In the distance you can see the figures of humans, fighting and clawing their way to the top.

You should have known this would happen. Gathering the most wicked of humans, those who have committed the most heinous of crimes, and giving them immortality was a recipe for disaster. But you were curious, and you wanted to see what would happen.

Now you regret it.

The screams echo in your ears as you turn and flee back to the world of the living. You can only hope that the humans can figure out a way to deal with this mess, because you know that you can't.

title: The Merciful Spider
body: You never kill the spiders in your home, you just whisper "today you, tomorrow me" when you set them outside. Now, in your most dire moment, an army of spiders arrives to have your back. You're surrounded by enemies, and you know you're not going to make it out alive. But as the spiders swarm forward, you can't help but feel a sense of comfort. You know that, even in death, you won't be alone.

title: The Last Patrol
body: I was on my final patrol in Afghanistan. Our unit had been out in the field for weeks with no relief in sight. We were all exhausted, running on little sleep and even less food. As we rounded a bend in the road, we spotted a Taliban roadblock up ahead. Our unit came to a halt and we quickly formulated a plan. I would take out the two guards on the left, while my unit mates would take out the two on the right. Just as we were about to move into position, one of the Taliban fighters spotted us. He yelled out and opened fire. bullets starting flying everywhere. I dove for cover and returned fire, but it was too late. I saw my unit mates falling left and right. I was the only one left. I was surrounded and outnumbered. I knew this was the end. As I prepared for the end, I heard a voice in my head. It sounded like my grandfather. He had always been a religious man. He told me to "Jesus take the wheel, Satan get behind me, Buddha... man the .50 cal". I don't know if it was the exhaustion or the adrenaline, but I followed his instruction. I manned the .50 cal and started firing. The Taliban fighters were dropping like flies. I managed to take out at least 20 of them before reinforcements arrived. I was a hero. My grandfather had saved my life.

title: The clock on the wall ticked loudly in the silence of the room, each second feeling like an eternity. I tried to close my eyes and will time to stop, but it didn't work. The minutes slowly passed by, the hours dragging on. I felt like I had been stuck in that room forever.
body:
I tried to close my eyes and will time to stop, but it didn't work. I tried to run to the other side of the world, but no matter how fast I ran, time always stayed the same. I tried to talk to other people, but they didn't seem to notice that time had stopped. It was like I was the only one who could move.

I tried to go back in time, but no matter how far I went back, time always stayed the same. I tried to go to the future, but time always stayed the same. I was stuck in the present, with no way to change the past or the future.

Then, one day, I met someone who could move in time like I could. They told me that there were others like us, people who could move through time, but that they were all scattered throughout time. They said that we were the only ones who could change the course of time, and that we had to be careful.

We decided to work together to try and fix the world. We went back in time and stopped wars from happening, we went to the future and stopped disasters from happening, and we saved lives. We were the Timekeepers, and we made sure that time flowed the way it was supposed to.

title: The Devil's biologist
body: You're a biologist who made a deal with the devil: eternity in hell after death in return for unlimited funding for your research. The funding was worth it, you discovered immortality, and the devil is not happy about this. He's come to claim his due, but you're not going down without a fight. You've discovered the secret to eternal life, and you're going to use it to defeat the devil and escape from hell.

title:
"Dear Santa,

"I have been a very good girl this year, and I would really like a pony for Christmas. My mom says I have to write to you to tell you how good I have been, so here goes.

"I have studied hard in school and gotten good grades.
body:
Your daughter has been begging you for a pony, and you told her to write a letter to Santa. On Christmas morning, you find a fire-breathing horse in your front yard, and a package by your front door. Looks like she wrote a letter to Satan, and he delivered.

You're not sure what to do with the horse, so you tying him up in the backyard and open the package. Inside is a book with instructions on how to train your horse to do tricks.

Your daughter is thrilled with her new pony and spends hours every day practicing. She's even entered him in a few competitions and won.

You're not sure what to think of the whole situation, but you're glad your daughter is happy. You just hope Satan doesn't come to collect his payment soon.

title: The Return of Pennywise the Clown
body: Pennywise wakes up after his 27 year sleep to find that four giant turtles and a rat have taken over the sewers. He is not happy about this and sets out to get rid of them. He starts by scaring the rat away and then turning his attention to the turtles. He tries to scare them away but they just keep coming back. He then decides to take care of them one by one. He starts with the biggest turtle and slowly works his way down to the smallest. Once he is done, he goes back to his lair to rest.

title: "The Best Oreo Flavor is the Surprise Inside"
body: You won a lifetime supply of Oreos when you were a kid. The apocoylpse and collapse of civilization was 30 years ago, yet every month the Oreos are still delivered to you, no matter where you are. You have no idea how it's possible, but you're not complaining. After all, Oreos are your favorite food and you've been living off of them for the past 30 years.

title: "I Was on Top of the World"
body:
I was on top of the world. I had a great job, a loving wife, and two beautiful kids. But I was bored. I had been following the green line for ten years and it had led me to a great life, but I was ready for a change. I decided to follow the red line.

The red line led me to a seedy part of town. I had never been there before and I was immediately nervous. I saw a group of shady looking characters huddled in an alley and I was about to turn and run the other way when I heard someone call my name.

It was my old friend Jake. We had grown up together and then lost touch after high school. I hadn't seen him in ten years.

"What are you doing here?" I asked.

"I could ask you the same thing," he said. "I've been following this red line for a while now. It's been leading me to some interesting places."

I told Jake about how bored I had been and how I was ready for a change. He understood completely.

"So what do you say we see where this red line takes us," he said.

I agreed and we set off down the red line. We had no idea where it would lead us, but we were excited for the adventure.

title: Theft
body: I was livid when I woke up to find that someone had stolen $10 from my bank account. I immediately started spending the rest of my money to try to get revenge. I hired a private investigator, put up reward posters, and even resorted to hiring a bounty hunter. But no matter how much money I spent, I couldn't find the person who had taken my money. I was left with nothing but a huge debt and a lot of anger.

title: The First Soviet Mars Landing
body: The Soviets were the first to land on Mars, but for some reason never told anyone. The flag they planted was discovered decades later by American astronauts. The Soviets won the space race, but at what cost?

 Irwin's boat sailed for weeks, until one day, he saw an island that he had never seen before. He decided to explore it.

body:
Steve Irwin, world-renowned adventurer and animal enthusiast, was bored. He had been to the ends of the earth, documenting and studying all sorts of different wildlife. But there was one place he had never been: Hell.

So, with a camera crew in tow, Steve Irwin descended into the depths of Hell to study the native wildlife. What he found was a world unlike anything he had ever seen before. The animals were fierce and demonic, and the landscape was a scorched and barren wasteland.

But Steve Irwin was undeterred. He bravely led the expedition, getting up close and personal with the denizens of Hell, all in the name of science. It was a dangerous and thrilling adventure, and one that Steve Irwin will never forget.

title: The Spatula's Place in Valhalla
body: After a long discussion, the advisory board has decided that a spatula does not count as a weapon and therefore you will not be going to Valhalla.

title:
The first sentence reads, "You were born on a cold winter day in 1985."

Your Life Story
body:
You sit down in your reading chair, eager to delve into the pages of your life story. You open the book and begin to read, but soon realize that this is no ordinary book. It's a choose your own adventure book with all of the decisions you ever made, and every outcome they could have had.

You flip through the pages, stopping at different points to see what could have been. If you had made different choices, would you have been happier? Would you have been more successful? There's no way to know for sure, but it's fun to imagine.

You close the book after a while, feeling grateful for the life you have. It's not perfect, but it's yours. And that's worth more than anything.

title: The Secrets of the Forest
body: forests. She was warned never to go out during a full moon, but her curiosity was too strong. She snuck out of her house one night during a full moon and took a peek at the moon. Suddenly, she turned into a log cabin. She was a werehouse.

title: The First Sentients
body: Humans are the first sentients, putting us millenia ahead of aliens. Instead of acting like an "elder" species should, we create mysterious artifacts with no actual use, crop cicles and send spooky messages, like "be quiet, you are in danger" to the aliens, because we are still childish morons.

title: Christmas Day on Reddit
body: You sit down at your computer on Christmas day, logged into Reddit. You see a post that catches your eye; it's a message from a stranger telling you that you are loved and accepted for who you are. They wish you a happy holiday season and a great new year. You can't help but feel touched by this message. You've always felt a bit out of place during the holidays, like you didn't quite fit in. But this message makes you feel seen and appreciated. You read it again and again, letting the words sink in. You feel a warm glow inside and you know that this holiday season is going to be a good one.

title:
"What the heck?" you mutter to yourself, as you read on.

You and Your Best Friend from High School
body:
Curiosity piqued, you open to the first footnote mention and are surprised to find a chapter on your best friend from high school. As you flip through, you start to notice that everyone who is mentioned in your book has a chapter devoted to them. Your boss, the cashier from the grocery store, your second grade teacher; they all have a story.

You read on, captivated by the tales of those around you, when you come to the final page and see your own name. Eager to know what your story says, you flip to the chapter only to find that it is blank. No matter how much you search, there is not a single word about you in the whole library.

As you stand there, stunned, you realize that this library is not about the people of Earth, but about you. Every single story is about your impact on the world and the people around you. This is your story.

title: I Will Always Be There
body: When I was 15, I told my girlfriend who I was "in love" with that I'd always be there when she was in need. Aphrodite heard me and made it a reality, whenever my girlfriend was in need I appear at her side. The problem is, we broke up after 3 weeks but I still appear even now, 10 years later. It's like I'm cursed to always be there for her, even though she doesn't want me around anymore. It's a humiliating experience, made even worse by the fact that I can't control when or how I appear. So, even though I don't want to, I keep showing up whenever she's in need, like a faithful puppy who can't help but keep coming back to its former owner.

title: You are Death, but in a post-apocalyptic world, only a few survivors remain.
body:
You are Death, but in a post-apocalyptic world, only a few survivors remain. You're doing everything you can to help them because if the last human dies, you die as well. The survivors can't see you, but they feel your presence and have noticed your efforts. They started to call you Life.

You help the survivors by guiding them to food and water, and protecting them from the dangers of the world. You are their invisible angel, and you do everything you can to keep them alive.

The survivors are grateful for your help, and they would be lost without you. They know that as long as you are with them, they have a chance of making it through this tough world. Thank you, Life, for everything you have done for us.

title: The Best Times
body: Two best friends, Tim and Steve, were having the time of their lives. They were laughing, joking, and just generally enjoying each other's company. However, their fun came to a screeching halt when they accidentally killed a man. They had no idea what to do. The Purge was only a week away, and they knew that if they didn't do something, they would be caught and arrested. They came up with a plan to fake the man's life until the night of the purge, when the murder would be legal. They created a social media profile for him, made up stories about his life, and even staged photos of him. It was a lot of work, but it was worth it. On the night of the purge, they killed the man and made it look like a Purge murder. It was perfect. No one suspected a thing.

As you start to sit up, you realize you're holding a bong. The aliens start speaking to you in a language you don't understand, but you get the gist of what they're saying. They're asking you how your trip was. You have no idea what they're talking about, but you take a hit from the bong and hand it to the aliens. They both take a hit and start laughing. Suddenly, it all comes back to you. You died back on Earth, and this is the afterlife. You spend the rest of eternity chilling with your new alien friends, getting high and enjoying the trip.

title: The Bro-ciples
body:
The Bro-ciples were always causing trouble. They would party all night and then show up late for Jesus' sermons. They would make crude jokes and hit on the women in the crowd. The other disciples were always complaint to Jesus about their behavior.

Finally, Jesus had had enough. He called the Bro-ciples into his chambers and told them that their behavior was unacceptable. He said that they were free to leave his inner circle and that he would find new disciples to replace them.

The Bro-ciples were heartbroken. They had loved being part of Jesus' group and causing mischief. But they knew that they had to respect Jesus' wishes. They said their goodbyes and went their separate ways.

The Bro-ciples continued to cause trouble, but they always had a soft spot in their hearts for Jesus. They knew that they had been lucky to be part of his group, even if it was only for a short time.

title: Phantom Arm Syndrome
body:
As an amputee, I experience phantom arm syndrome. It's when you feel like your amputated limb is still there and you can move it even though it's not really there. It's a weird sensation, but I don't mind it too much. That is, until one day I realized I could use my phantom arm to punch ghosts.

I was lying in bed, trying to sleep, when I heard a noise coming from my closet. I slowly got out of bed, thinking it was just a rat or something, but when I got to the closet I found a ghost trying to steal my clothes. I was so surprised that I instinctively punched it with my phantom arm. The ghost let out a blood-curdling scream and then vanished into thin air.

Since that day, I've been using my phantom arm to punch ghosts whenever they try to haunt me. It's become my new hobby and I even started a blog about it. Who knew that being an amputee could have so many benefits?

title: The day my human video filter stopped working
body: I was in the middle of a big court case when my human video filter stopped working. I had to think fast and convince the judge that I was a real, human lawyer licensed to practice law in the state of Texas. I did it by using my expert cat knowledge and by speaking in a very serious legal voice. The judge was so impressed that he ruled in my favor and I won the case!

title:
My parents never let me out of their sight, though, so I had to be content with reading about other people's adventures. That is, until I turned eighteen. Finally free from my parents' ironclad grip, I set out to see the world for myself.

I started small, visiting different countries
body:
Ever since I was a small child, I wanted to explore the world. I was fascinated by stories of adventure and excitement, and I dreamed of one day having my own adventures. So, when I was given the opportunity to join an Arctic exploration, I jumped at the chance.

But fate is a cruel mistress. I was the only one to survive the expedition, and I was soon captured by a band of tiny warriors. They placed me under an enchantment, and each year I am forced to go out into the world as their unwilling emissary. They call me "slave," or in their tongue, "Santa."

I hate my life. I'm a grown man, and yet I'm forced to act like a child, delivering presents to good little girls and boys. It's humiliating. I long to be free, but the enchantment is strong. I am their Santa, whether I like it or not.

title: "Rent"
body: A schizophrenic man gets sick of the voice in his head and asks it to start paying rent if it wants to live there. The next morning he finds an envelope filled with cash on his desk. The man is shocked and pleased. He decides to take the money and use it to pay his rent. The voice in his head is happy to have helped out and is happy to continue living there rent-free.

I wished for a world without hate or war.

I wished for a lifetime of friendship with the people I love.

I looked at the candle in front of me and made my wish. I was joking when I said that I wanted to be fire proof. I never thought that it would actually come true. But when I accidentally lit the company breakroom on fire, my boss just laughed it off and said that I was the person who couldn't be fired, ever.

I was happy at first. I loved having a job that I could never be fired from. But eventually, the novelty wore off and I realized that I was stuck in a job that I didn't even like. I was constantly surrounded by people who were trying to get rid of me, and it was really stressing me out.

I tried to quit a few times, but each time I got close, something would happen to stop me. I would get sick, or there would be some kind of emergency. It was like the universe was conspiring against me.

I was starting to think that maybe my wish wasn't such a good thing after all.

title: The Mystery of Death
body:
Humans have always been fascinated by death. It is the one thing that we are guaranteed to experience, yet we know so little about it. We try to understand it by studying the lives of those who have died, but we can never know for sure what happens after death. We can only imagine.

Death is just a predator much higher on the food chain than we are, and our perception of it is as limited as an ant's perception of a child with a magnifying glass. We can see death coming, but we can't comprehend its true nature. We can only watch as it takes us away.

title: The Life and Times of a Primate
body: After you die, you find yourself back 25 million years ago, asleep in a tree as a primate. You realize that your entire life was just a long, vivid hallucination brought on by eating a strange mushroom. However, you also find that you have acquired a great deal of knowledge from this experience. You are now the smartest living being on the planet, and you use your knowledge to help your fellow primate friends.

title: The Joke That Became My Reality
body: When offered one wish, I jokingly said that I want to be fire proof. I was disappointed to discover that fire still burned me. When I accidentally lit the company breakroom on fire, my boss just laughed it off and I began my new career as the person who can't be fired, ever.

title: Linda and the Rustling Bush
body:
Linda was walking home from work when she heard a rustling in the bushes. She was scared that there might be an animal lurking, but she decided to investigate anyway. She slowly approached the bush and peered inside. To her relief, there was no animal, only a small bird fluttering around. Linda felt silly for being so scared and continued on her way.

Suddenly, she heard the sound of something big running towards her. She turned around and saw a large predator heading right for her. She had no time to react before the predator was upon her, and she was dead.

Linda's death was just a small part of the predator's day. To the predator, Linda was nothing more than a small snack. Her perception of death was limited by her small size and lack of experience. To the predator, death was just another part of the food chain.

title: The Life and Times of a 25 Million Year Old
body: As I awoke dangling from a tree, I could not help but think back to my life 25 million years ago. I was a Hominid Primate, and I had the great fortune of stumbling upon a funny looking mushroom. After consuming the mushroom, I had a vivid hallucinations where I lived an entire lifetime. In this hallucination, I was the smartest living being on the planet. I knew everything there was to know, and I was able to use this knowledge to help my fellow Hominids. I taught them how to use tools, how to build shelters, and how to find food. I even showed them how to make fire. My knowledge was a great gift to my tribe, and I was able to help them thrive.

title: The VR Goggles
body: I don't remember ever removing the VR goggles I got for my 10th birthday. I tried them out and thought they were dumb, so I just went on with my life. But now, decades later, looking back, I realize I must have been wearing them the whole time. I can't even remember taking them off. It's like they've become a part of me. I guess you could say I've been living in a virtual reality for the past few decades. And to be honest, I'm not sure if I ever want to leave.

title: The Dwarves: A Proud and Hardworking Race
body: The dwarves are a proud and hardy people, known for their love of ale and Mead. They often drink to excess, but that is part of their culture and they would never change it. One day, however, one of the dwarves decides to give up alcohol, and discovers that doing so grants him amazing powers. He can suddenly remember everything that happened the night before, no matter how much he drank. He also finds that he has increased strength and agility, and can even see in the dark. He is suddenly the most powerful dwarf in the clan, and is able to help them achieve great things.

The woman's mind was racing. She had to think of something, fast. If she didn't, who knows what the demon would do to her.

And with that, the demon placed a curse on the woman that would prevent her from ever using magic again.

The meeting went on and I learned that, every 10 years, I would be expected to attend this same meeting. I would relive the same meeting, but each time from a different angle. I would be 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80, and 90 years old. 

I was excited to see what my future selves would be like. I couldn't wait to learn from them and grow into the person I was meant to be.

title: A terrifying experience
body:
I was walking home from getting groceries when I was grabbed from behind. A cloth was shoved over my mouth and I was thrown into the back of a van. I tried to fight back, but there were too many of them. They tied me up and put a blindfold over my eyes. I was aware of the fact that I was being taken to some kind of temple, based on the sounds I could hear. There was the sound of a large door opening, and then I was being carried up some stairs. I was placed on some kind of altar and my blindfold was removed. I saw the group of people standing around me, all wearing robes and chanting. In the center of the room was a large statue of a man with horns. I realized that I was about to be sacrificed to their god.

The problem was, I was immortal. I had forgotten about this prank I had pulled centuries ago, where I had pretended to be a god. I had given these people immortality, and now they worshipped me as if I was a real god. I tried to reason with them, but they weren't listening. They were going to sacrifice me anyway.

Luckily, the god they were actually worshipping was a close friend of mine. He showed up just in time and saved me from being sacrificed. We had a good laugh about the whole thing afterwards. As for the cult, we dispersed them and turned them into regular people again. They probably don't even remember who they used to be.

title: The Teleporting Mutant
body:
You are a mutant in Xavier's school for gifted youngsters with the power to teleport, well that's what you tell everyone. In reality you can pause time and you're not ready to be an omega class mutant. You're not sure how you got this power, but you're grateful for it nonetheless. It allows you to do things that others can only dream of.

You've used your power to help out your friends and teammates on many occasions. But you know that if anyone found out about your real power, they would be terrified. So you keep it a secret, only using yourpower when absolutely necessary.

One day, you accidently let slip to one of your friends about your power. At first they don't believe you, but after seeing you use it they're convinced. They beg you to teach them how to do it too.

At first you're reluctant, but you eventually give in. You show them how to pause time and then release it. They're ecstatic and can't wait to use their new power.

But as you watch them use it, you can't help but feel a little bit worried. What if they misuse their power? What if they get caught? There's no telling what could happen.

You just hope that they'll be careful with their new ability.

title: "You are secretly the richest person in the world."
body:
You are secretly the richest person in the world. But to avoid suspicion of having so much money, you decide to work a normal office job. One day, your boss fires you. But what he didn't realise... Was how incredibly petty you are, and the lengths you will go to get back at him.

You create a plan that will ruin your boss and take away everything he has. You start by anonymously donating large sums of money to his political rivals. Then you buy up all the land around his house, so he's left with nothing but a tiny plot of land. You also buy up shares in his company, so that when you release information that he's been embezzling money, his company stock plummets and he's left with nothing.

You've taken away everything he has, and he's left with nothing but regret. Meanwhile, you're secretly the richest person in the world, and you've taken away everything from the man who wronged you.

title: The Great Wizard
body: There was once a great wizard who ruled over all five universes. He was a powerful sorcerer and could control the elements. However, one day he met his match. A young girl who was just learning how to use her magic. She was able to defeat him and take his place as the ruler of the universes.

title: I'll be waiting in purgatory for you.
body: When I die, I'll be waiting in purgatory. I'll be judged by the four people most impacted by my actions: the person I was the most cruel to, the person I was the nicest to, the person who was saved by my actions, and the person who died because of my choices. I hope that they'll be able to see how sorry I am and how much I've changed. I hope they'll forgive me and let me into heaven.

title: Puppyhood Stories: Celestial Beings Known as Humans
body:
As a puppy, I was told stories of the celestial beings known as humans. They were said to live for more than 500 years and were the caretakers of our canine families. I never thought I would meet one, let alone seven.

But then, one day, my caretaker died.

I was sad, of course. But I also felt a sense of awe and wonder. I would never see her again, but I knew that she would always be with me in spirit.

Now, I am the caretaker of my own family. And I will never forget the lessons I learned from the humans who came before me.

title: The People of the New World
body: The first thing that the people of the new world did was to bring forth the old gods. They were the strongest, the smartest, and the tallest. They had places of splendor and objects that were rare. They immediately created a religion and followed the gods that were shown in the Guinness Book of World Records. The new world was a better place because of the old gods.

title: The Luckiest Man Alive
body: I was born with a luck rating of 100. I had always been a lucky person and I thought that would continue when I was sent to prison. I was sure my luck would get me out of there easily. But then I saw that all the other inmates also had luck ratings of 100. I started to realize that luck wasn't going to be enough to get me out of this place. I was going to have to find another way.

title: The Best Fiddler Ever
body: Johnny was the best fiddler ever. He could make the devil dance with his music. One day, he went down to Georgia to challenge the devil to a fiddle contest. Whoever won would get the other's soul. Johnny played his heart out and won. The devil was so upset that he gave Johnny his fiddle and asked for his soul in return. Johnny proudly proclaimed that he was the best fiddler ever. A flash of lightning crashed down and God appeared, fiddle in hand. The devil got his popcorn ready to watch the show.

title: When my father left to buy a pack of cigarettes, it was a typical day.
body: It was a typical day when my father left to go buy a pack of cigarettes. I was a child then, and I didn't understand why he never came back. It is 10 years later and I'm a teenager when my father walks back in, wearing the same clothes he left in, and insists he has only been gone half an hour. I can't believe it! It's like he never left.

title: The Death Row Conspiracy
body:
I was sitting in my cell, waiting to die. I had been sentenced to death for my crimes, and I knew that there was no escaping it. I had made my peace with it, and was ready to die. But then, they said that you die twice. The first time when you stop breathing, and the second time when somebody says your name for the last time. I didn't know what that meant, but I was about to find out.

I was escorted to the execution chamber, and I lay down on the cold, hard floor. The executioner came in, and I heard him say my name. And then I died. But I didn't go to Heaven or Hell. I found myself in a place called Purgatory.

Purgatory is a place where all the great philosophers and authors go when they die. It's a place where we wait to die again. And that's when I realized that I wasn't really dead. Not yet, at least. I still had one more death to go.

I saw all the great philosophers and authors in Purgatory, and we would talk and debate all day. We talked about life, and death, and everything in between. And I found myself learning more in Purgatory than I ever did in life.

But eventually, even Purgatory comes to an end. And one day, I heard somebody say my name for the last time. And that's when I died for good.

title: The Grim Reaper's Journey
body:
The Grim Reaper is the first human to die, and had taken it upon himself to walk the deceased to the afterlife so that they do not have to feel the loneliness he felt. He had done this for millennia, and had never once faltered. But now, as he looked upon the newest soul to cross his path, he felt a twinge ofsomething he had not felt in a long time.

The new soul was a young woman, barely more than a child. And as he looked into her eyes, he was reminded of his own mortality. He was reminded of the loneliness he had felt when he first died, and how he had vowed to never let another soul feel that same way.

And so, with a heavy heart, he took the young woman's hand and led her into the afterlife.

body: As a paramedic, I often have to use my knowledge of history to inform my practice. I was Immortal, after all, and I had been a paramedic since the 30-years War. I often found myself slip into old habits, which my coworkers were always astonished by.

"Hey, what are you working on?" the angel asked.

"I'm working on a new painting," I replied.

"What's it supposed to be?"

"Well, it looks like it's going to be a great painting," the demon said. "You have a lot of talent."

I smiled and continued working. It was nice to have some company, even if they were just imaginary.

title: The Man at the Door
body:
I was sitting in my living room when I heard a knock at the door. I got up to answer it and found an alien standing on my porch. He was wearing a suit and tie and carrying a briefcase.

"Can I help you?" I asked.

"Yes, I was wondering if I could ask you a few questions," the alien said.

"Sure, come on in."

I led him into the living room and we sat down.

"So, what can I do for you?" I asked.

"I was wondering if it's true that you can only see three basic colors?" the alien asked.

"It is."

"So, how do you communicate with the Ghoosha?"

"With whom?" I responded confused.

"The other major race on your planet."

"Oh, we don't communicate with them," I said. "We don't even know they exist."

The alien looked surprised. "How can you not know they exist? They're the second most populous race on your planet!"

"Well, we've never seen them," I said. "And no one has ever told us they exist."

"That's very strange," the alien said. "I thought for sure you would be able to tell me more about them."

"I'm sorry, I wish I could help you more," I said.

The alien thanked me for my time and left. I sat there for a while, wondering if what he had said was true. Could there really be another race of beings on our planet that we don't know about? It seemed impossible, but I couldn't shake the feeling that there was more to this than meets the eye.

The man is wearing a mask, but you can see his eyes and they look kind. He hands you back your wallet and tells you to be more careful in the future. You thank him and he walks away. You're not sure what just happened, but you're grateful that the man was there to help.

title: The Great Balance
body:
A long time ago, the galaxy was in equilibrium. For every sentient creature that was born, another must die. However, over the last few centuries, there have been billions of unexpected deaths. The galactic counsel has finally discovered the cause: a long ignored planet where a group of bipeds can't stop reproducing.

The counsel has decided to intervene and establish a population limit on the planet. Whenever one of the bipeds is born, another must die. The counsel knows that it won't be easy to enforce this, but it is necessary in order to maintain the balance of the galaxy.
