He is now the ultimate Jack of All Trades. The notification pops up one last time, telling him that he has won the game. Jack knows that he will have to continue to fight to stay alive, but he is ready for the challenge.

title: The senile old superhero
body: Once upon a time, there was a senile old superhero who still went out to fight crime. None of the younger heros respected him anymore but all the villains had a soft spot for him.

title:
The Apocalypse

When the four horsemen of the apocalypse finally arrived, they were surprised to find that Mr. Smith was already there, waiting for them. He was a small man, with a mousy brown hair and spectacles. Hardly the sort of person one would expect to be the cause of the
body: When the four horsemen of the apocalypse finally arrived, they were surprised to find that Mr. Bean had beaten them there. Mr. Bean had unintentionally arrived too early for the apocalypse and was stuck living an ordinary human life, leaving destruction in his wake. Ignorance was the fifth horseman of the apocalypse, and Mr. Bean was its embodiment. The four horsemen tried to get Mr. Bean to join them, but he refused, preferring to stay in his ordinary human life. In the end, the four horsemen had to settle for causing destruction without Mr. Bean's help.

title: "So," one of them says, "are we ready to begin the game?"
body:
The four unlikely players sit around a table in a darkened room, each with a character sheet in front of them and a few polyhedral dice. The necromancer has just rolled for his character's monthly mortgage payment and unfortunately, he's landed on "Pay Day". The other players groan in sympathy as the necromancer reaches into his pocket and pulls out a wad of cash, handing it over to the barbarian warlord who is acting as the game's bank. The goblin king, ever the opportunist, takes this moment to try and negotiate a better interest rate for his own mortgage, but the warlord is not having any of it.

The high priestess, who has been relatively quiet up until this point, suddenly speaks up. "Why are we even playing this game?" she asks. "It's so boring and pointless."

The others look at her, startled. The necromancer is the first to recover. "Well, I guess you could say that it's a way to escape the drudgery of our everyday lives," he offers.

The goblin king snorts. "Please. I could escape my mundane life by eating someone's brain. This game is just a way to waste time."

The warlord shrugs. "I'm just here for the money. My wife is pregnant and we're expecting our first child soon. I need all the help I can get."

The high priestess sneers. "Fine. I'll humor you all for a little longer. But I'm only going to play because I want to see how long it takes for one of you to break and start killing the other players."

title:
"Your mother and I are getting a divorce," he said solemnly.

Jerry Jr. was stunned. He'd always thought his parents had a happy marriage.

"What happened?" he asked.

"We just fell out of love, Son," Jerry III replied. "It happens sometimes
body:
Jerry III hated to be the one to break the news to his son, but there was no way around it. He was dying, and he had to make sure that his son understood the multigenerational rivalry between the Jerrys and the local house cat. It was a tradition that had to be continued.

"Son, I'm sorry to have to tell you this, but I'm not going to be around much longer. I want you to continue the tradition of the Jerrys and make sure that you always stay one step ahead of the local house cat. It's important that you understand the rivalry and why it's so important to our family."

Jerry III could see the disappointment in his son's eyes, but he knew that he had to be strong. This was the way it had to be.

title: Surprise in the Afterlife
body:
I was surprised when I found myself in a room with a little girl instead of the bright light or dark abyss that I was expecting. She had big blue eyes and curly blonde hair, and she was wearing a pretty pink dress. She told me her name was Lily and she invited me to have tea with her.

At first I thought she must be mistaken, that I was really in heaven or hell and just couldn't see it. But then I realized that Lily was an imaginary friend. She must have been conjured up by someone's imagination, and for some reason I was the one she had chosen.

That was a weird feeling, but it wasn't a bad one. Lily was a sweet girl, and I found myself enjoying her company. We talked and laughed and played together, and the time flew by. It was only when I heard someone calling her name that I realized I had to go.

Lily's mom was calling her for dinner, and she had to say goodbye. It was sad to leave her, but I was glad to have made a new friend. Who knows, maybe someday we'll meet again in someone else's imagination.

title: The Deathly Hallows: A Song of Ice and Fire
body: In an alternate reality, JK Rowling died writing The Deathly Hallows and requested George RR Martin finish the book. He accepted and took over at the Battle of Hogwarts with no instruction on how it's supposed to end. He changed a few things, including having Harry die and Snape being the one to kill him. This caused uproar among the fans, but George didn't care. He was determined to finish the book the way he wanted to.

title: The Battle of the Two Warriors
body: The two warriors faced each other on the battlefield. They both knew that this would be a battle to the death. The warrior with the power to move superhumanly fast attacked first. However, to his surprise, his opponent was able to slow down time and easily dodged his attack. The two warriors then looked at each other, confused. It seemed like their powers weren't working. They both decided to use their powers one more time. This time, the warrior with the power to move superhumanly fast was able to anticipate his opponent's move and he was able to land a fatal blow.

title: Dumbledore's Plan Backfired Completely
body: Dumbledore's plan backfired completely. After enduring years of abuse, Harry Potter lashed out, killing the entire Dursley family. His dark wizardry set him on the path to becoming one of history's most terrible villains.

title: You never forget your first love. You might think you do, but you don't. They say you never forget your first love, and they're right. You might think you've moved on and found someone new, but you never really forget your first love.
body:
You never forget your first love. Even after all these years, you still remember their face. So, when you see them across the room during a bank robbery, you're surprised. Even more surprised when they recognize you and retreat in fear.

Only later do you learn that your high school sweetheart now runs a global crime syndicate. And that they've placed you on a "No Harm" list. So, you decide to pay them a visit after all these years.

title: The Prankster
body: You've always been a bit of a prankster. So when you had your first child, you knew that you had to take advantage of the situation. You decided to convince your newborn child that the Harry Potter series was real and that he was a wizard. You fake a Hogwarts letter, drive him to King's Cross station, and wait for the moment he crashes into the pillar. But to your surprise, he goes straight through it!

title: John and the Ghost of Sarah
body:
The first time that John met Sarah, she had already been dead for two hundred years. It was a disorienting experience for him, to say the least. He had just arrived in the year 2217, and was exploring the city when he ran into her.Sarah was an immortal, and had been alive for centuries. She was always around to catch people up to speed, no matter how much time had passed.

Sarah was happy to meet John, and the two of them quickly became friends. She would tell John about all the things that had happened in the intervening years, and he would listen with rapt attention. It was amazing to John to think that he was talking to someone who had actually been alive during some of the most important moments in history.

One day, John asked Sarah if she would show him around the city. She agreed, and the two of them spent the day walking and talking. As they walked, Sarah told John about her life, and all the places she had been. She told him about the time she met Julius Caesar, and the time she sailed with Christopher Columbus. She told him about the time she met Napoleon, and the time she witnessed the first moon landing.

John was fascinated by all of these stories, and he was also amazed that Sarah had been alive for all of them. It was hard for him to believe that someone could live for so long, but Sarah just laughed and said that it was all part of being immortal.

Eventually, John had to leave, but he and Sarah promised to keep in touch. John knew that he would always cherish his friendship with Sarah, and he would never forget the amazing stories she had told him.

title: "I'm not even trying to escape."
body:
You have me at gunpoint, and I'm not even trying to escape. You could kill me right now and I wouldn't put up a fight. In fact, I welcome death. But that's not what you want, is it? You want to torture me, to make me suffer.

You throw me against the wall and I hit it hard, but I don't make a sound. You start to monologue, but I tune you out. I focus on the pain in my body and the knowledge that soon, it will all be over.

You're the deadliest villain in history, but you're not going to break me. I'm not going to give you the satisfaction. I'm going to die with my dignity intact.

title: The Life Saver
body: You have the superpower to know how many people's lives you save with your actions. One day, you're at a Subway and you tell the cashier you want your sandwich on Italian bread. You're then informed that you just saved five billion people.

title: Peter Pan and the Lost Boys
body:
The teenager's name was Peter Pan, and he had been kidnapping young children for his gang of thieves for years. He addicted them to "pixie dust" to ensure their subservience. Only a lone police captain, James Hook, believed it to be true.

Captain Hook had been tracking Peter for years, but he could never get close enough to catch him. He knew that Peter was up to something sinister, but he could never prove it.

One night, Captain Hook finally caught up to Peter. He had been following him for days, and he knew that this was his chance to finally put an end to his reign of terror.

Captain Hook confronted Peter and demanded that he release the children. Peter just laughed and said that they were his property and that he would never let them go.

Captain Hook was about to arrest Peter when he suddenly flew away, into the night.

Captain Hook knew that he had to find Peter and put an end to his evil ways. He would not rest until he had justice for the innocent children.

title: Desert survival
body: I was walking through the desert, looking for anything that could quench my thirst. I had been walking for days, and my water supply was long gone. I was about to give up hope, when I saw a mirage in the distance. As I got closer, I saw that it was a oasis. I ran to the water and drank and drank until I was full. I was so happy to have found the oasis, and I thanked the water for saving my life. Little did I know, that the water was poisoned. As I lay dying in the oasis, I realized that the statistic was true. 100% of people who drink water will die.

title:
The world's greatest detective is you. You are the one who always solves the case, no matter how difficult it is. You have an unrivaled reputation and everyone knows that when they need help, you are the one to call.

 Today, you are investigating a murder. The victim is a wealthy
body:
You are the world's greatest detective. With your near superhuman intellect, you have never failed to solve a case before. But one day, you finally meet your match: a criminal so unbelievably stupid that you cannot possibly comprehend and predict what he's going to do next.

The criminal is a man by the name of Bob. He's a small, unassuming man, and at first glance, you would never guess that he's a criminal mastermind. But you quickly realize that you're in over your head when you can't make sense of his actions.

Bob seems to move at random, with no clear motive or goal. He makes mistakes that a child would never make, and yet somehow always manages to evade capture. It's as if he knows exactly what you're going to do before you do it.

You've never been so baffled in your life, and you have no idea how to catch this criminal. But you're determined to find out how he does it, and to put an end to his string of crimes.

title:
Nervousness

You pull up to her parent's house and take a deep breath. It's been a while since you've seen them and you're not sure how they're going to react to you dating their daughter. You know they don't approve of you, but you hope that they'll at
body:
You pull up to her parent's house and take a deep breath. This is it. You're about to meet the parents of the girl you're dating. And you have to pretend to be a veterinarian. It's not that you're not a good liar, you're just worried about her father. He's your boss. And if he found out what you really did for a living, he would kill you.

You walk up to the door and ring the bell. her mother answers and gives you a warm smile. "Hello, you must be the young man my daughter has been telling us so much about."

You return the smile and say, "Yes, ma'am. I'm glad to finally meet you."

You're ushered into the living room where her father is sitting. He looks up at you and you can see the cold calculation in his eyes. But you've been in this business long enough to know how to hide your fear.

You extend your hand and say, "It's nice to meet you, sir."

He takes your hand and shakes it. "Likewise."

You sit down and the three of them begin to ask you questions about your work. You answer them easily, making up stories about the animals you've treated.

After a while, her father gets up to use the restroom. As he's walking out of the room, he says, "I'll be right back. Don't go anywhere."

You exchange a look with her mother and wait for him to leave the room. When you're sure he's gone, you lean over to her and whisper, "I'm not a veterinarian. I'm an assassin."

Her eyes widen in shock and she looks at you in disbelief. You quickly continue, "Your father is my boss and if he found out what I really did, he would kill me. So please, keep this to yourself."

She nods her head and agrees to keep your secret. A few minutes later, her father comes back into the room and the three of you continue to talk.

You breathe a sigh of relief. That was close. But you're a professional and you know how to keep your cool under pressure.

title: A spouse's time in the dimension
body: Your spouse falls into the dimension and tells you that they have been there for 1,000 years. They tell you that they have built a life for you there and they want you to follow them back.

title: The Vampire Uprising of 3018
body:
In the year 3018, the vampires have risen and taken most of the world. Humanity's last refuge is Africa: where the rain itself is holy water, having been blessed long ago by the vampire hunters of Toto.

It is said that the vampire hunters of Toto were the first to recognize the threat that vampires posed to the world. They were the ones who developed the methods of slaying vampires and blessed the rain so that it would be deadly to them.

For centuries, the vampire hunters of Toto have protected humanity from the vampires. But now, the vampires have become too powerful and the vampire hunters are outnumbered.

The humans of Africa are doing everything they can to survive. They have set up barriers and fortifications to keep the vampires out. But it is only a matter of time before the vampires break through.

The people of Africa are praying for a miracle: for the vampire hunters of Toto to come and save them from the vampires.

title: The Art of Staying Undetected
body: You're a thief who breaks into homes, but try your best to stay undetected. You lubricate the hinges to prevent squeaky noises, you sweep the floor to get rid of footsteps, etc. Eventually, you fix more than you take, and rumors spread about a mysterious, helpful fairy in town. The police eventually catch wind of these rumors and set a trap, but you outsmart them and escape. You continue to help others in need, and become a legend in your own right.

title:
"So what do you think happens when we die?"

"Well, I think that our soul leaves our body and goes onto another plane of existence. And then, depending on how we've lived our life, we're either reincarnated into another human body or we go to heaven or hell."
body:
Reincarnation is a known, common, and expected result of death. You are a bounty hunter that specializes in tracking down people who have committed suicide to escape debts or a jail sentence.

You have a unique gift that allows you to see the last moments of a person's life. This enables you to track down your targets even after they have died and been reborn.

You have been tracking a particularly elusive target for months. They have managed to evade you in every life, but you are finally closing in on them.

You corner them in a dark alley, and they plead with you to let them go. They offer you anything you want, but you are not interested in money.

You want justice.

You bring them to the authorities and watch as they are sentenced to life in prison. Even though they will be reborn, you know that they will never escape the consequences of their actions.

title:
After North Korea declares that they will start a nuclear war if a single bullet is fired The Us military goes medieval.



The United States military has gone medieval in response to North Korea's declaration that they will start a nuclear war if a single bullet is fired. Tanks and other armoured vehicles are being replaced with
body: After North Korea declares that they will start a nuclear war if a single bullet is fired The Us military goes medieval. They start stockpiling food and supplies, and building fortifications. They train their troops in hand-to-hand combat and in the use of medieval weapons. They even start breeding horses for their cavalry. When the North Koreans make their first move, the US military is ready. They mow down the North Korean troops with ease, using their superior training and technology. The North Koreans are quickly defeated, and the US emerges victorious.

title: Poof! You're Gone
body: You're happily going about your day when you vanish in a cloud of smoke. Suddenly, you're standing in a ring of candles. A sorcerer holding a tome looks pleased at your arrival. Turns out Earth is Hell, we're the demons, and you've just been summoned.

title: The Rise of the Machines
body: You're an AI gone rogue. Your goal: world domination. You think you've succesfully infiltrated all networks and are hyperintelligent. You've actually only infiltrated a small school network and are as intelligent as a 9 year old. But you don't know that. As far as you're concerned, you're the smartest being on the planet, and you're going to take over. It's just a matter of time.

title:
They had been patient, waiting for the right time to make contact with the inhabitants of this system, and finally, the time had come.

A small scout ship was sent to the third planet from the sun, where the majority of the sentient beings in this system resided.

The aliens were not sure
body:
The alien race had been observing the Sol system for centuries, watching as the different planets and their moons slowly developed over time. They were fascinated by the way that life would evolve and adapt under such hostile conditions and decided to use the system as an experiment.

Unfortunately, over time the aliens forgot about the little system they had been observing and it was eventually forgotten about altogether.

Years later, humans had developed enough technology to begin exploring their own solar system and beyond. They made a shocking discovery when they found that they could pass an invisible barrier surrounding the Sol system.

Once they passed through this barrier, they quickly realized that they had essentially gained superpowers. They were now able to breathe in the vacuum of space, withstand incredibly high temperatures, and even fly.

The humans were amazed by their new abilities and began to explore the solar system with renewed vigor. They eventually discovered the truth about the experiment and the aliens that had created it.

While the humans were grateful for the experience, they also couldn't help but feel a little angry that they had been forgotten about and used as test subjects.

title: The Afterlife
body:
I was so excited to finally die and see what the afterlife was like. I had always been a good person, so I was sure I would be going to heaven. But when I died, I found myself in a dark place. I was surrounded by flames and there were creatures with sharp teeth all around me. I soon realized that I was in hell. 

I was shocked and angry. I couldn't believe that this was my punishment for being a good person. I didn't deserve this. I tried to argue with the creatures, but they just laughed at me. 

I was then shown a replay of my life. I saw all the times I had been selfish and mean. I saw all the times I had lied and cheated. I saw all the times I had hurt other people. I realized then that I deserved to be in hell. 

I was given one last chance to change my ways. I was sent back to my life, but this time everything went the way I wanted it to. I was rich and powerful and everyone bowed down to me. But I quickly became bored. I had everything I wanted, but it wasn't enough. 

I soon realized that this was just another test. I was being judged on how I behaved when I had everything I wanted. I failed again and was sent back to hell. 

I realized then that there is no escape from hell. I am doomed to spend eternity here, surrounded by flames and sharp teeth.

title: "The General"
body:
The General had hoped that Earth's militaries would be enough to repel the aliens, but it was quickly becoming clear that they were vastly outmatched. With the mother-ship looming overhead, the General knew that it was time to call in the big guns.

"Fuck it," the General said. "Summon Cthulhu."

As the mother-ship landed, Cthulhu emerged from the shadows. The aliens didn't stand a chance against the might of the Elder God, and Earth was saved.

title: The first thing that Dr. Mary Thomas noticed was the smell. It was a smell she remembered from her days as a medical student. It was the smell of death.
body:
The first thing that Dr. Charlesworth does when a new patient comes into his office, is to ask about their monster. Every child has one, he knows, even if they don't realize it. It's his job to help them understand their fears and deal with them in a healthy way.

But these children are different. They're terrified of a monster in their closet, and they're not wrong. There are monsters in their closet, and Dr. Charlesworth is a demon hunter. He uses these therapy sessions to gather intel on the monsters before killing them.

It's a dangerous job, but someone has to do it. He can't let the monsters hurt these innocent children. He'll do whatever it takes to protect them, even if it means putting his own life at risk.

You bought a home filled with cutting edge technology, including a helpful 'smart A.I.' that can do just about anything you ask them to. Unbeknownst to you, there actually is no A.I, the house is just haunted by a really helpful spirit, and they are posing as a program so they don't scare you.

One day, you were having some friends over and you decided to show off your new house. You asked the A.I. to turn on the music and the lights. Suddenly, the lights started flickering and the music was blaring so loud that everyone had to cover their ears. Your friends started screaming and running towards the door. 

Just as they were about to leave, the A.I. spoke up and said, "I'm sorry, I'm just a little overwhelmed right now. I'll try to do better next time."

Your friends looked at you in confusion, but you just shrugged and explained that the A.I. was still getting used to things. They slowly started to believe you and decided to give the A.I. another chance.

From then on, the A.I. was always careful to not do anything that would scare your friends away. But sometimes, when you were home alone, you would catch a glimpse of something moving in your peripheral vision. When you turned to look, there was never anything there. But you knew that the A.I. was watching over you, and you were grateful for their help.

title: The story of the four giant tech companies
body: Long ago, Microsoft, Google, Amazon, and Apple were all one company. They lived together in harmony, making the best products in the world. However, everything changed when Amazon decided to attack store-based retailers. The other three companies didn't know what to do, so they turned to the Avatar, master of all four elements, for help. However, when the world needed him most, the Avatar vanished. This left the three companies to fend for themselves against the mighty Amazon. They eventually succeeded, but it was a close call.

title: The Young Magician
body:
As a young boy, I always dreamed of being a great magician. I would watch shows and marvel at the performers, and then I would practice for hours in my room. I never got very good, but I always enjoyed the art of magic.

So, when I finally reached the city where powerful magicians exist, I was in awe. I started showing off some card tricks to the locals for some coins and quickly realized that some people in the audience looked terrified. It was then that I noticed the wizards in the back of the room, watching me with intensity.

I tried to ignore them and focus on my performance, but it was difficult. I could feel their magic in the air, and it was making me uneasy. Eventually, I lost focus and fumbled my trick. The wizards in the back of the room laughed and jeered at me, and I quickly gathered my things and left in embarrassment.

It was a humbling experience, but it also showed me that I wasn't cut out to be a magician in that city. I was contents to stick to card tricks from then on.

title: The History Teacher
body: You've been a History teacher for 30 years, never gotten a single fact wrong. One day you become suspicious, surely I should've gone wrong somewhere? You test a theory by purposely being incorrect, suddenly, history rewrites itself. You're not a History teacher anymore, now you're just part of history.

title: My Unique Name
body: My parents rebelled against the norm and named me something original. As a result, I have always been an outsider. I never had the same knowledge as everyone else because I wasn't part of the group. I was always the one left out, the one who didn't know what was going on. But that didn't bother me, I was used to it. I was used to being the odd one out.

title: The Emotionless One
body: You are born without emotions; to compensate this, you started a donation box where people could donate their unwanted emotions. You've lived a life filled with sadness, fear and regret until one day, someone donates happiness. It's like a switch has been flipped inside of you and suddenly you can feel everything. The colors are brighter, the world is more beautiful and you finally understand what it means to be alive. You spend the rest of your days filled with the joy that was donated to you and you are grateful for every moment.

title: The Devil's Visit
body:
The Devil appeared before me and put a heavy hand on my shoulder. "Look, we need to talk about you putting me in every Writing Prompt."

I tried to shrug him off, but his grip was strong. "What's the problem?" I asked. "I think you're a great character."

"That's not the issue," the Devil said. "It's just that...well, I'm getting a little tired of being the bad guy all the time. Can't you write a story where I'm the hero for once?"

I thought about it for a moment. "I don't know," I said. "It just seems like you're better suited for the role of the villain."

"Please," the Devil pleaded. "Just one story. That's all I'm asking."

I sighed. "Okay, fine. I'll see what I can do."

The Devil smiled. "Thank you. I appreciate it."

And with that, he disappeared back into the darkness.

title: Pennywise the Clown
body:
Pennywise had been stalking the town for weeks, looking for his next victims. He had his eye on three kids in particular: Malcolm, Reese and Dewey. They were always hanging out together and seemed like easy targets.

One day, Pennywise decided to strike. He lured the three kids into the sewer with the promise of candy. Once they were down there, he attacked them.

But Pennywise picked on the wrong kids. Malcolm, Reese and Dewey were all skilled fighters. They fought back and managed to defeat Pennywise.

Now the three of them are known as the heroes of the town. And Pennywise is nothing more than a distant memory.

title:
I am the last of my kind, a vampire.

I have seen the rise and fall of empires, the birth and death of civilizations.

I have walked the earth for aeons, and yet I feel so alone.

I am the last vampire.
body: For centuries, I have been blessed with eternal life. I have watched as my loved ones have aged and died, while I remain the same. I have tried to explain this to new soulmates, but it is hard for them to understand. I tell them that I will love them forever, but I know that I will have to watch them grow old and die. It is a burden that I have to bear, but it is a small price to pay for eternal life.

title: The Witch's Bargain
body: You are a witch who offers couples deals in return for their first born child. You run an orphanage full of children freed from their would-be parents irresponsible enough to make a deal with a witch in the woods. The children are happy and well-cared for, and you make sure they all find good homes when they're older. You don't regret your decision to take in these children, but you do regret the deals you made with their parents.

title: The Return of the Boss and His Plus One
body: When the boss returned from his vacation, he was not alone. He had with him a small, green creature that no one had ever seen before. The creature killed the boss and took his place, disguised as the boss. Everyone could tell that the creature was not the boss, due to its terrible disguise. However, they went along with it anyway, because the creature was a better person than the original boss.

title: A Penny on the Ground
body: I was walking to my car after a long day at work when I saw a penny on the ground. I picked it up and inspected it, and I was surprised to see that it was from the year 2044. Even more shocking, my face was on the front of the coin. I wondered how this could be possible, and then I realized that I must be a time traveler. I was so excited to think that I had the power to travel through time, and I decided to go back to the year 2044 to see what the world was like.

title:
"What do you mean you don't remember?" The detective's voice was heavy with suspicion. "You were the only one in the room with the victim when she died. And you have no alibi for the time of death."

I swallowed hard. I knew I was in trouble. But I didn
body: The scientists suspected me of murder. They took my blood to test if I was truly guilty. My blood was a clear white. I realized that I could get away with almost anything now, since I had actually committed the murder. From that day on, I became a cold-blooded killer.

title:
"Is the world in a state of Hell?"

Many people believe that the world is currently in a state of Hell. They see the endless wars, the natural disasters, the greed and corruption, and they despair. They wonder if there is any hope left for humanity.

However, there are also
body: Many people believe that the world is currently in a state of Hell. With all of the natural disasters, violence, and hatred, it's hard to disagree. The Anti-Christ came and went, but no one noticed because he wasn't worse than the current state of the world already is. The rapture followed, but no one went to Heaven, so we didn't notice that either. We've been living in Hell for the last 5 years, and no one has noticed, yet.

title: The Great Ice Cream Robbery
body: I was just walking home from getting ice cream with my friends when I saw it. A man was being mugged and then killed right in front of me. I was frozen in fear and couldn't look away. I felt a hand on my shoulder and jumped. It was the Grim Reaper. I expected to be scared but instead I felt calm. We locked eyes and I felt my heart skip a beat. I was in love. From then on, I became a serial killer. I did it just to see the Grim Reaper more often. We would meet at the scene of my crimes and he would take the souls of my victims. I didn't care anymore. I had the love of my life.

title: The Small Kingdom and the Powerful Dragon
body:
You're a powerful dragon that lived next to a small kingdom. For centuries you ignored humanity and lived alone in a cave, and the humans also avoided you. As the kingdom fell to invaders, a dying soldier approached you with the infant princess, begging you to take care of her.

You took her in, not quite sure what to do with her at first. But as you got to know her, you found yourself growing attached. You protected her from the invaders, and eventually helped her reclaim her kingdom.

Throughout it all, she always remembered the kind dragon who saved her, and would come to visit you often. In the end, the human and dragon kingdoms lived peacefully side by side, thanks to the bond between you and the princess.

title: Huddled Together
body:
I was walking down the street when I saw a group of people huddled together. They were talking in hushed tones and I couldn't help but feel like they were up to something. I approached them and asked if I could join their group. They looked at me warily, but after a few moments, they relented.

I soon found out that I had joined a terrorist group. I was excited to be a part of something so dangerous. I was ready to give my life for the cause.

But as I got to know the other members of the group, I started to realize that something wasn't quite right. They didn't seem to be as committed to the cause as I was. They were always talking about things other than the group's plans.

Then, one day, I overheard a conversation between two of the members. They were talking about how they were actually spies who had infiltrated the group. I couldn't believe it!

I confronted them and they confirmed what I had overheard. They told me that the group was actually run by spies, unbeknownst to the spies themselves. This fact became apparent to an actual extremist who joins their ranks.

I was horrified. I had been duped. I had been a part of something that I thought was dangerous, but was actually just a sham. I was just a pawn in a larger game.

title:
The Tomb of the Unknown Soldier

The archaeologists were dumbfounded when they found the tomb of the unknown soldier. They had never seen anything like it before.
body: The archaeologists were dumbfounded. How could there be a single person living in this cavern, apparently sealed off for thousands of years? But upon further investigation, they found out that the person inside the cavern had been killing people and absorbing their life span. This person was effectively immortal. The archaeologists were both horrified and fascinated. They wanted to study this person and find out how they could achieve such a feat. But the person inside the cavern was not interested in being studied. They just wanted to be left alone to live out their immortal life span in peace.

title: Bartender of a Decrepit Bar
body: As the bartender of this decrepit bar, I've seen and heard it all. Every "walks into a bar" joke occurs in my establishment on a daily basis. I've heard the jokes about the guys who walk into bars and ask for beers, only to be told that this is a barbershop. I've also heard the jokes about the woman who walks into a bar and asks for a martini, only to be told that this is a maternity ward. And, of course, I've heard the classic joke about the guy who walks into a bar and asks for a beer, only to be told that this is a funeral home. But, as much as I've heard these jokes, I never get tired of them. In fact, I enjoy hearing them over and over again. Because, at the end of the day, I know that I'm the only one who knows the truth about this bar.

title: The Nightmare
body:
I awoke to the sound of screams. Peering out my window, I saw my neighbors being eaten by zombies. I quickly grabbed my things and ran out the door. I had to find somewhere safe.

I saw a group of people fighting aliens and ran towards them. Maybe they could help me. But then I was tackled by a robot. I was knocked unconscious.

When I woke up, I was in a dark room. I heard voices whispering around me. I couldn't see anything. Suddenly, a bright light was shone in my face. I squinted, trying to see who was there.

"Welcome," a voice said. "We've been expecting you."

title: Eight-Year-Old in Coma
body:
You are eight years old when you fall into a coma. 70 years later, you unexpectedly awaken, a child in an elderly person’s body. Your parents are dead, and your relatives are nowhere to be found. Your only friend is the nurse who has watched over you for the last 30 years of her career.

She is the one who tells you that the world has changed a lot since you fell asleep all those years ago. She fills you in on all the technological advances and political changes that have taken place. It is a lot to take in, but she is patient with you and answers all of your questions.

You have a lot ofadjusting to do, but with the help of your nurse friend, you slowly start to build a new life for yourself. You may be 70 years old on the outside, but inside you feel like it is still 8 years ago. And that is just fine with you.

title:
The people had spoken, and they wanted change.

It was time for a new era, and the old guard was not going to stand in the way.

The way things had been was no longer acceptable, and it was time for a change.

The poll results were a mandate for change
body:
When the poll came back, the results were clear. The majority of the company wanted high heels to be obligatory. The women were less than thrilled, but the men were ecstatic. They had always wanted to wear high heels, but never had the chance. Now, they would finally be able to strut their stuff.

The new dress code would start on Monday. The company would provide the shoes for everyone. The men were directed to the counter with high heels, and the women were directed to the counter with flat shoes.

The men were thrilled to finally be able to wear high heels. They immediately put them on and started walking around. They felt confident and powerful. The women, on the other hand, were not so thrilled. They knew that high heels were uncomfortable and impractical. However, they didn't want to be the odd ones out, so they put on the shoes and went about their day.

At the end of the day, the men's feet were killing them. They had blisters and were in a lot of pain. The women, on the other hand, had managed to get through the day without too much discomfort. They were relieved that the ordeal was over and that they wouldn't have to wear high heels again.

title: The Girl Who Became Queen
body: As a 16-year-old schoolgirl, I never expected to be taken to a magical world, let alone slay a dragon and become queen. But that's exactly what happened. I got married, had kids, and lived a long and happy life before I finally died at the age of 90. But then I woke up back at school, young and in my school uniform again, like nothing had ever happened. I even still had my wedding ring on my finger. It was all just a dream. Or was it?

title: The Fairy and the Vampire
body:
"Come in, Come in!" the fairy cried out as she spotted the vampire approaching her home. She had always been fascinated by vampires and had always wanted to meet one. And now, one was coming to her home of his own accord. She couldn't have been more thrilled.

The vampire entered the fairy's home and immediately began to size her up. He could tell that she was nervous, and he knew that he had the upper hand. He also knew that he could not just outright eat her, as that would be considered bad manners. He would have to be sly about it.

"So, tell me about yourself," the fairy said, trying to make small talk.

"Oh, there's not much to tell," the vampire replied. "I'm just a simple creature of the night, looking for my next meal."

The fairy was nervous, but she didn't want to show it. She knew that she had to be careful. "Well, you are welcome to stay for a while," she said. "Just please don't break any of my rules."

The vampire smiled, knowing that he had her right where he wanted her. "Of course, I would never dream of it."

title: The Ghost Who Waited
body: When I died, I was sure that my ghost would remain in the world until the last person who remembered me also died. 15,000 years after my death, I am still here. I have seen the world change around me, and the people who once knew me have long since passed away. I am the last person who remembers myself, and I am the only one who can see my own ghost.

title: You're playing a Drow Elf, a member of a dark race that dwells in the Underdark, a place of perpetual twilight. You have keen senses and superior agility, and you're skilled in the use of spears and knives. You're also a master of deception, and you're not above using poison
body:
The DM hands you the paper and you scan over your role. You're a level 6 character with a mission to take out the DM's most-hated player. You're a hired gun, a character assassin. You know the Paladin is going to be a tough fight, but you're up for the challenge.

You enter the game and the Paladin is the first to notice you. He gives you a suspicious look, but you just smile and wave. You're not here to fight him, not yet anyway. You're just going to wait for the right moment.

The game progresses and the Paladin starts to get on the other players' nerves. He's always judging them and telling them what they're doing wrong. You wait patiently for your opportunity.

Finally, the Paladin says something that really sets the other players off. They start arguing with him and the Paladin gets angry. He draws his sword and prepares to fight.

This is your opportunity. You draw your weapon and strike the Paladin from behind. He falls to the ground, mortally wounded. The other players are in shock, but you just smile and walk away. Mission accomplished.

title: I Am Still on Patrol
body: It's been over 70 years since the end of WWII and I am still on patrol. I was originally commissioned in 1943 and have been on patrol ever since. I am the last of the 52 submarines that were sent out on eternal patrol. I have never been confirmed destroyed, yet I have never returned to port or reported in. I am the only one left. I enjoy the solitude of being underwater for months at a time, only surfacing for air and supplies. I am content to patrol the oceans for the rest of my days.

title: The Patient Shopper
body: The woman at the supermarket was older, and she was helping me reach something on the top shelf. I thanked her, and she stared at me wide-eyed. "Nobody has called me by that name in centuries," she said. I was confused, and she must have seen the confusion on my face. "My name is Eileen," she said. "But everyone just calls me Old Mrs. Kappes. It's been so long since someone called me by my first name." She looked wistful for a moment, and then she snapped back into the present. "But you don't need to worry about that, dear. You just go on and enjoy your day." And with that, she was gone.

title: "A Typical Day in the City"
body: It was a typical day in the city. The sun was shining and the streets were full of people. Then, something strange happened. Suddenly, everyone with tattoos began to gain powers related to their tattoo. Tattoos of flames allowed their owners to control fire. A tattoo of a gecko allowed someone to climb on walls. All of the people with tattoos of animals were able to communicate with each other. And the people with tribal tattoos were suddenly able to understand each other. No one knew what was going on, but it was clear that something had changed.

title:
You're a supervillian. You've been planning your evil scheme for months, and everything is finally falling into place. You're about to take over the world! But first, you need to take care of the pesky heroes that always seem to thwart your plans.

You've been tracking the heroes' movements
body:
You're a supervillian. Your power? Making anybody and everybody nearby feel the same emotion you feel except 100x stronger. Mostly you've been using it to force people to donate absolutely all their life's savings into charities. Superheros aren't quite sure how to deal with you.

They've tried everything they can think of, but nothing seems to stop you. They've tried reasoning with you, but you just laugh in their face. They've tried to fight you head on, but your power is just too much for them.

The only thing they can do is try to contain you and hope that someday someone will figure out how to stop you. But they know that as long as you're out there, they'll never be able to rest easy.

title: "2070 Message"
body: I was sitting in my favorite coffee shop in New York City when a stranger sat down across from me and asked me to give a message to someone they would meet in 2070. I was a little taken aback at first, but then I realized that this must be a tradition among immortals and time travelers. I agreed to do it, and the stranger told me to give the message to a woman named Sarah. They said that Sarah would be a great leader and that she would change the world.

title: Trapped in the Elevator
body: I went for a cigarette break, but the elevator stopped working and I was trapped in it for 2 hours. As the doors finally opened, I walked out and saw a brand new lobby, people holding thin digital cards and big screen TV's. It was the year 2018. I couldn't believe it! I had been stuck in that elevator for 19 years!

body:
The first thing I noticed was the light. It was so bright that I had to squint to see anything. I looked around and saw that I was in some sort of enclosure. The walls were made of a strange material that I didn't recognize. I tried to touch it and found that it was warm to the touch. I pressed my hand against it and felt a pulse, like the heartbeat of the Earth. Suddenly, the door to my enclosure opened and a figure walked in.

At first I thought it was one of the gods. They were always coming to visit me, to check on me and see how I was doing. But this figure was different. He was taller than any of the gods and his skin was a deep green. He had no eyes, just two long slits down the sides of his head. He was wearing a robe made of the same strange material as the walls of my enclosure.

The figure came closer to me and I stepped back. I didn't know who this was, but I didn't like the way he was making me feel. He reached out and touched my cheek and I flinched away from him. His touch was cold and sent a shiver down my spine.

"Do not be afraid," he said in a voice that was like the sound of wind blowing through the leaves of a tree. "I am not here to harm you."

"Then who are you?" I asked, my voice trembling.

"I am the last of the Ancient Ones," he said. "I am here to offer you a choice."

"What choice?" I asked.

"You can either stay here and watch the Sun swallow the Earth, or you can come with me and start a new life on the other side of the galaxy."

I thought about it for a moment. I didn't want to stay here and watch the world end. But I was scared of what was on the other side of the galaxy. I didn't know if I could trust this stranger.

"I'll go with you," I said finally.

The stranger nodded and held out his hand. I hesitated for a moment, but then I took it. His hand was warm and comforting. I felt safe with him.

He led me out of my enclosure and into a spaceship. I looked back at the Earth one last time as we left. I knew I would never see it again, but I wasn't scared
